title: Do people still use typewriters in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for A2A. Do people still use typewriters in 2020? The majority of domestic printers, and many office-grade laser printers fail to handle envelopes very well. For those offices that don’t use pre-printed envelopes with letter-address windows, the basic daisy-wheel typewriter is still on the market for incompatible envelopes. The majority of these are restricted to 10/12 pitch, and very simple in construction to keep the price down. Brother and Silver Reed tend to lead this cheap market, the Brother having a few more inbuilt smarts. Each brand is not wheel or ribbon compatible with the other. Older, long established offices will still have what is almost a vintage typewriter reserved for the same purpose.

I think so, given that major retailers like Staples, Walmart and Amazon.com still sell them. The only practical advantage I can think a typewriter has today over a computer and printer is addressing envelopes.
